decks.notes: This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on utilizing graveyard recursion and sacrificing creatures for value. By consistently bringing back creatures like Gravecrawler and Marionette Apprentice with cards like Unearth and Agadeem's Awakening, the deck can quickly build up a board presence and drain the opponent's life with cards like Zulaport Cutthroat. Cards like Chatterfang, Squirrel General and Boggart Trawler provide additional value through token generation and card draw. With a mix of aggressive creatures and graveyard synergies, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory in a 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor, allowing the player to quickly play powerful land cards like Lotus Field and Urza's Saga. The goal is to eventually cast Primeval Titan and search for key lands such as Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber, generating a lot of mana and creating a combo finish with cards like Kessig Wolf Run. The deck is built around utilizing powerful lands and creatures to create a fast and efficient win condition in the mid to late game.

The main idea of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo using cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom to deal massive damage to the opponent without relying on lands. It also includes cards like Thassa's Oracle and Selective Memory to manipulate the top of the library and win the game quickly. The deck focuses on disruption and control with cards like Force of Negation, Subtlety, and Disrupting Shoal to protect the combo and slow down the opponent's strategies. Overall, the goal is to achieve a quick and unexpected victory through a well-executed combo.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana using rituals and medallions, while also utilizing Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible to draw cards and filter through the deck. Wish serves as versatile toolbox for finding key combo pieces, while Wrenn's Resolve protects key permanents. The goal is to generate a critical mass of mana and cards to cast Past in Flames and combo off with multiple spells in one turn. The deck aims to win with a massive storm count and burn out the opponent in one explosive turn.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various spells and abilities, with a central focus on utilizing The One Ring card to gain advantage and maintain control over the opponent. Cards like Subtlety, Force of Negation, and Counterspell help disrupt the opponent's strategies, while cards like Wrath of the Skies and Supreme Verdict provide board control. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and win the game through careful decision-making and resource management.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing a combination of creatures with powerful abilities and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion allows for additional flexibility and consistency in the deck. The main strategy revolves around using Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's plans, while quickly building up a board presence with creatures like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls. The deck also incorporates cards like Goblin Bombardment and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to deal direct damage and finish off the opponent swiftly.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature strategies with an emphasis on dealing damage quickly to the opponent. It utilizes cards that can pump up creatures and enhance their abilities to maximize their damage output. The combination of low-cost creatures and efficient removal spells allows for a fast-paced gameplay and puts pressure on the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of various lands and support cards helps to maintain consistency and control the flow of the game, while also providing additional ways to deal damage directly to the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using disruptive cards such as Architects of Will and Subtlety, while setting up for a powerful combo finish with Living End. By cycling through your deck with cards like Street Wraith and Shardless Agent, you can quickly assemble the pieces needed to cast Living End and return all creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield. With the addition of cards like Endurance and Force of Negation for protection, this deck aims to outvalue and overwhelm opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.
